Package de.renew.net

This package defines the basic building block for defining nets and net instances: places and transitions.

Package de.renew.net Description

This package defines the basic building block for defining nets and net instances: places and transitions. It does not yet deal with arcs and transition instances.

Most classes in this package assume that their methods are called within simulation threads only. Assertions reflecting this assumption have been added to all public accessible operations (state-manipulating methods) and (de-)serialization methods of these classes. However, there are some exceptions, where execution within a simulation thread is not guaranteed:

  • IDRegistry, IDCounter, IDFactory, TrivialIDFactory, and IDSource may be used within the garbage collector's thread since they count references to objects. The same holds for the methods PlaceInstance.reserve(Object) and .unreserve(Object) that control ID reference counting.
  • TimeSet provides generic functionality that might be reused outside simulations.
  • The static management part of Net is not restricted to simulation threads. However, the request for nets by name might initiate the simulation-thread-dependant net loading mechanism. Therefore, the Net.forName(String) method includes a convenience wrapper.
  • The weak reference lists (NetList, NetInstanceList) are not relevant for the simulation itself.
